items.title: Ikea's Smart Home Revolution: Embracing Matter
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Ikea is relaunching its *smart home line* with over 20 new Matter-over-Thread compatible products, enhancing interoperability.  
- The Dirigera smart home hub now supports Matter, enabling easier integration with devices from various brands.  
- This shift positions Ikea as a pioneer in mainstreaming Matter technology, making smart homes more *affordable* and user-friendly.

items.title: Ikea's New Speaker Lamp Ditches Sonos for Spotify
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Ikea's latest speaker lamp shifts from **Sonos** to a more affordable **Bluetooth** design featuring **Spotify Tap**.  
- The new **Blomprakt** speaker lamp launches at under €100, appealing to a broader audience with price points much lower than previous Sonos options.  
- Embracing lessons learned from their Sonos partnership, Ikea aims to enhance product accessibility and explore innovative home integration solutions.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Compatible with Existing Docks
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- *Nintendo Switch 2* works with existing USB-C docks and webcams after firmware updates. 
- Three manufacturers have successfully adapted their devices: **AverMedia**, **Elgato**, and **Viture**. 
- Continued compatibility may depend on future Nintendo firmware updates that could restrict third-party devices.

items.title: TCL 85-Inch TV on Prime Day Sale: A Great Deal

- Improved **viewing angles** ensure vibrant images for all viewers, enhancing the experience for movie nights and game days.

items.title: Apple’s design team will report to Tim Cook
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple CEO *Tim Cook* will take over direct oversight of the design team following COO Jeff Williams' retirement. 
- The transition aligns with Apple's upcoming *Liquid Glass design language*, which aims to unify design across its devices. 
- This significant change is part of Apple's broader strategy to enhance user interactions and integrate innovative features across its product line.

items.title: Supreme Court Supports Trump's Federal Workforce Cuts
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The *Supreme Court* allows the Trump administration to proceed with mass federal layoffs while a lawsuit against them is ongoing.
- This decision lifts a previous *injunction* that paused the layoffs until legality was determined.
- Critics argue the ruling undermines *democracy* and jeopardizes vital public services.

items.title: Prime Day 2025: Top Deals on Games & Accessories
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary:

items.title: Jeff Williams Retiring, Sabih Khan Named COO
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- *Sabih Khan* will succeed **Jeff Williams** as COO of Apple, effective later this month. 
 - Williams, notable for overseeing the launch of iconic products like the *iPod* and *iPhone*, is retiring after a long tenure.  
 - Khan, a 30-year Apple veteran, faces new challenges with Apple's supply chain amidst current geopolitical issues.

items.title: Apple’s AirPods Pro 2 Discounted

items.summary:
- The **AirPods Pro 2** are now available for **$149**, a **$100 discount** from the original price.  
- This model features improved **noise cancellation**, sound quality, and a **USB-C** charging case.  
- Additional benefits include **FDA approval** as hearing aids, **6 hours** of battery life, and seamless integration with other Apple devices.

items.title: Microsoft’s New 12-Inch Surface Pro for $685
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- The **12-inch Surface Pro** is available for *$685*, $115 off its standard price.
- This tablet features a refined design and is powered by the **Snapdragon X Plus** chip, providing a more tablet-like experience.
- While it excels in performance and battery life, its software experience in tablet mode requires improvement compared to the iPad.

items.title: Gmail's New Feature for Easy Unsubscribing
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Google introduces a *Manage subscriptions view* in Gmail to help users handle subscription emails.  
- This feature allows users to see a list of frequent senders with *one-click unsubscribe* options next to them.  
- The rollout starts on the web, followed by Android and iOS apps, making it accessible across *personal Google accounts* and *Workspace users* in selective locations.

items.title: Samsung S90D OLED TV: Best Prime Day Deal

- Users can host or join meetings in VR using any Zoom license, supporting various Meta Quest models.
- The app integrates features like seeing other participants and passthrough mode, enhancing the immersive experience.
- Zoom continues to innovate with AI avatars, expanding its virtual interaction capabilities.

items.title: Challenges in Flash Flood Warnings
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- *Flash floods* develop rapidly, complicating accurate forecasting and timely warnings.
- Texas's recent flooding highlights degraded federal support for **climate research**, affecting real-time predictions.
- The integration of advanced data collection and enhanced communication methods is essential to mitigate risks in forecasting flash floods.

items.title: Amazon gets the green light to sell the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Amazon has started listings for the *Nintendo Switch 2* in the US, allowing users to register for an *invitation* to purchase. 
- This follows Nintendo's previous removal of listings from Amazon due to pricing disputes with third-party sellers. 
- The Switch 2 has reportedly become the *fastest-selling game console* of all time since its launch on June 5th.

items.title: 55 Prime Day Deals Under $50

items.title: TSA Ends Shoe Removal Policy for Airport Security
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The TSA is set to allow travelers to keep their *shoes on* at select airports, reducing a long-standing security requirement. 
- This change is a shift from the shoe removal policy implemented after the 2001 shoe bombing attempt, believed to offer little actual *security benefit*. 
- Critics argue that such measures often merely create an illusion of safety without addressing real threats, highlighting the need for more effective *security practices*.

items.title: Jack Dorsey Launches Encrypted Bluetooth App Bitchat
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- *Bitchat* is a new peer-to-peer messaging app from Jack Dorsey that uses **Bluetooth** for encrypted communications without internet access.
- The app features privacy protections like *password-protected channels* and a *Panic Mode* to secure data quickly.
- Unlike similar apps, Bitchat boasts a range over 300 meters, making it more effective for private messaging in proximity.

items.title: Best Prime Day Smart Home Deals

items.summary:

- Expected announcements include the *Galaxy Z Fold 7* and *Z Flip 7*, alongside the *Galaxy Watch 8 series*.
- Viewers can watch the livestream on *Samsung's website* or their *YouTube channel*.

items.title: How The New York Times is (still) getting gamed by the right
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- The *New York Times* faces criticism for its news judgments, especially regarding its framing of stories about candidates like Zohran Mamdani.
- Coverage that aligns with right-wing narratives often leads to *controversial journalism* practices, risking the paper's credibility.
- The paper's attempt at *objectivity* sometimes results in a skewed depiction of reality, further embedding its reputation issues.

items.title: Waymo Introduces Teen Accounts for Robotaxi Service
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Waymo launches *teen accounts* in Phoenix, allowing those aged 14-17 to ride unaccompanied. 
- Enhanced safety measures include real-time location sharing and remote operator support for teen riders. 
- This initiative responds to declining teen driver's license rates and increasing interest in ride-hailing services among younger generations.

items.title: Google Maps on Garmin Smartwatches
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Garmin introduces a *free Google Maps app* for its smartwatches, providing basic *turn-by-turn directions*.
- The app requires an Android smartphone for destination searches, limiting its features compared to *Wear OS*.
- It supports over *90 smartwatch models* and vibrates for navigation prompts, allowing users to track their activities simultaneously.

items.title: The Last of Us Part II's New Mode in Chronological Order

items.summary:

While budget options can perform well, users should *mind the battery life and basic obstacle detection* capabilities that might require initial tidying up before operation.
